2.heading: The Downfall of an Arrogant King.
2.title: "Vali : The Downfall of an Arrogant King"
2.author: script, Tyagaraj Sharma ; illustrations, Ram Waeerkar ; editor, Anant Pai
2.appears_in: 31 p. in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 546 (1976, 2010 printing).
notes: (Epics & Mythology)

Summary from back cover: "Vali's days were numbered. Brave enough to confront the most vicious of demons, and strong enough to destroy them every time, he unfortunately could not conquer his own pride. Foolishly, he turned his adoring brother, Sugreeva, into a mortal enemy and drove him to take the help of that supreme warrior, the mighty Lord Rama."

3.title: "The Downfall of Superman" : Chapter 2 of "The Team of Luthor and Brainiac"
3.author: [No author]
notes: Villains: Lex Luthor, Brainiac, Jax-Ur, Prof. Vakox, Phantom Zone inmates.
Introduction of Tharla (Luthor's future wife).
Guest appearance: Lexorians.
Data from Bob Rivard, Martin O'Hearn, Lou Mougin via Grand Comic-Book Database.

A plug for the Spy Smasher movie.

6.heading: Downfalls.
6.title: "Fred Potter Plots Chuck's Downfall"

notes: "To be continued."

7.heading: Downfalls.
7.title: "The Lord of Lanka : the Rise and Fall of a Demon King"
7.author: script, Anant Pai ; illustrations, Pulak Biswas ; editor, Anant Pai
7.appears_in: 32 p. in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 541 (1974, 2010 printing).
notes: (Epics & Mythology)

Summary from back cover: "Ambition and arrogance, these were the cause of Ravana's downfall. Blessed by both Brahma the creator and Shiva the destroyer, the powerful ruler of Lanka could have enjoyed fame and respect had he only reined in his arrogance. It was left to Vishnu the preserver to find a way to curb Ravana. In the process, there unfolded one of the world's most beautiful romantic sagas, the story of Rama's love for his devoted Sita."

8.heading: Downgrading.
8.title: "It's Part of Our New Candor Program"

notes: Summary: The claim of actual weapons of mass destruction in Iraq has been downgraded to a claim that there was a program for weapons of mass destruction.

A new invention that plugs into the brain helps them function, and the dictator of Italy is one example. He has decreed that all citizens must walk the streets naked with their hands on their heads starting in April.

85.heading: Dows, Chris.
85.title: Bison
85.author: Clayton, Dows, Campbell, Townsend.
notes: Originally serialized in 2000 AD, progs 1301-1309.

"Jack Bison is the kind of guy they don't make anymore. A hard-boiled, take-no-prisoners cop out to avenge the death of his wife at the hands of crime boss Enrique Esposito. But when he's fired from his beloved force, he needs a new angle of attack, and the body-swapping technology of Internet 4 has the answer. Now, Bison plans to swap with Esposito's daughter, Charisma; but she has her own plans for Jack Bison's body."

148.heading: Doyle, John, 1797-1868.
148.title: Political Sketches, &c.
148.author: by H
notes: In 10 vols.
"H.B." is John Doyle (1797-1868).
For explanation of plates see: Thomas MacLean, An illustrative key to the political sketches of H.B., nos. 1-600.
These sketches were issued a few at a time, at irregular intervals, from 1829-1851; a total of 917 sketches were issued, cf. Stephen, Dict. of nat. biog.
Tipped in v. 10 are publisher's flyers advertising nos. 901 to 911, and no. 917, and autograph letter from Francis Harvey [art dealer in London] giving the names of nos. 901-917.
Sketches 901-917 blind-stamped "Subscribers copy".

175.author: Susanna Doyle.
notes: between 1988 and 2008.
"Dedicated to Barbara Randall, whose new Barbara is going to be a wonderful addition to the DC Universe no matter what legacy Alan Moore left to her."

Summary: Fan fiction in the Batman universe, set immediately after the incident in the 1988 graphic novel Batman : the killing joke, in which the character Barbara Gordon is shot by the Joker and left paralyzed. The story follows Dick Grayson's wait for news about her condition from hospital staff and then his visit to her bedside.
